title: About Qiu Min Ji
body:
Qiu Min (Rebecca) Ji



1989-1993: Master Degree of Arts in Theology, Bethany Theological Seminary.

1993-2002: Performing musician in the greater area of Chicago K-12 schools, for assemblies and concerts, including performing at the Chicago Arts Institute, the Chicago Field museum, many concerts as Erhu soloist with the Chicago Symphonic Orchestra and Milwaukee Symphonic orchestras.


1992, Founded the Chinese American Cultural Bridge Center

Awards: Illinois Arts Council performing Arts Roster (1997-1999)
Illinois Arts Council performing Apprenticeship (1999)
Illinois Arts Council Music Fellowship Award (2000)
1982-1986 Equivalent to Bachelor of Arts in ESL, Nanjing Teachers college, & Nanjing University, China
1969-1981 Performing musician of violin and Chinese Erhu, for Peking Opera, Music teacher in Elementary and Middle School, Kaifeng China

2000- 2009, Executive director of the Chinese American Cultural Bridge Center.
Initiate music performances and cultural exchanges between China and US. Selected and arranged High rankingAmerican High School Bands and Orchestras to perform in China concert halls, schools and festivals, exchanging culture with Chinese students.

2008 summer arranged and tool two American marching bands who represented America to participate in the Beijing Olympic International Youth Festival.
